event.title: started as a company town in 1886

data.event: Wilson started as a company town in 1886 by Robert E. Lee Wilson, who would build a cotton empire and run it from the city.
Wilson did not incorporate until 1959, and remained in the Wilson family until 2010.

event.title: remained in the Wilson family until 2010

data.event: Wilson did not incorporate until 1959, and remained in the Wilson family until 2010.
Wilson started as a company town for Robert E. Lee Wilson's nearby logging and sawmill operation founded in 1886.
In 1900, a major archaeological find occurred near Wilson when James K. Hampson discovered the Island 35 Mastodon.
